amendment.description: Amendment requires the lifted ban to be assessed after 10 years and directs the Secretaries of Energy and Commerce to work together to review the impact of lifting the ban as it relates to promoting U.S. energy and national security and report their findings to Congress.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 9 printed in Part B of House Report 114-290 to require the lifted ban to be assessed after 10 years and directs the Secretaries of Energy and Commerce to work together to review the impact of lifting the ban as it relates to promoting U.S. energy and national security and report their findings to Congress.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Jackson Lee amendment (A008) Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Amendment (A008) offered by Ms. Jackson Lee.
House amendment offered/reported by : Amendment (A008) offered by Ms. Jackson Lee.
House amendment agreed to: On agreeing to the Jackson Lee amendment (A008) Agreed to by voice vote.
Amendment agreed to Committee of the Whole
